snippet.desc: This Behavior is responsible for keeping track of the current animation and overriding that animation (if appropriate) when a new animation request is made.
snippet.description: This Behavior is responsible for keeping track of the current animation and overriding that animation (if appropriate) when a new animation request is made.
snippet.name: Animation Manager

list.desc:
Enter in a list of animation categories.
Animations that are higher up will override
the ones below it.
list.name: _CategoryHierarchy

number.desc: Set the amount of time the screen will fade after falling in. In and Out will be the same.
number.name: _FadeTime

number.desc:
Set this to how long you wish to wait before reloading the scene.
Useful for displaying a Spawned Actor on Death animation so it completes before the reload.
number.name: _TimeBeforeReload

snippet.desc: This Behavior controls the player's jumping.
snippet.description: This Behavior controls the player's jumping.
snippet.name: Jumping

control.desc: Select the key used for jumping.
control.name: _JumpKey

number.desc:
Maximum amount of time that the
jump force will be applied when holding down the jump button.

default = 0.075
number.name: _MaxJumpTime

animation.desc: Animation used for jumping to the right.
animation.name: _JumpRightAnimation

animation.desc: Animation used for jumping to the left.
animation.name: _JumpLeftAnimation

number.desc:
When releasing the jump key before reaching the max
height, what is the rate of upward slowdown?

default = 0.75
number.name: _JumpingSlowdown

number.desc:
Amount of force applied when jumping.
Default = 35
number.name: _JumpForce

snippet.desc: This Behavior is responsible for slowing the player down when no direction keys are being pressed.
snippet.description: This Behavior is responsible for slowing the player down when no direction keys are being pressed.
snippet.name: Slowdown

control.desc: Select the control used to move to the right.
control.name: _RightKey

control.desc: Select the control used to move to the left.
control.name: _LeftKey

number.desc:
Rate of slowdown while on the ground.

default = 0.9
number.name: _GroundSlowdown

number.desc:
Rate of slowdown while in the air.

default = 0.99
number.name: _AirSlowdown

number.desc:
Rate of slowdown while ducking.

default = 0.975
number.name: _DuckingSlowdown

number.desc:
Rate of slowdown while moving through the air.

default = 0.975
number.name: _MovingAirSlowdown

number.desc:
Amount of horizontal slowdown while in the water
default = 0.95
number.name: _WaterSlowdown

snippet.desc: This Behavior determines if the player is on the ground and sets an Actor Level Attribute as appropriate.
snippet.description: This Behavior determines if the player is on the ground and sets an Actor Level Attribute as appropriate.
snippet.name: On Ground

boolean.desc: Only detect that the player is on the ground if standing on a tile?
boolean.name: _LimitToTiles

list.desc: If not limited to tiles, enter in any Actor Group that you want to exclude from ground collisions.
list.name: _ExcludedGroups

snippet.desc: Reload the scene if an actor with this behavior has it's health depleted. Requires the Health behvaior to function correctly.
snippet.description: Reload the scene if an actor with this behavior has it's health depleted. Requires the Health behvaior to function correctly.
snippet.name: Reload Scene on Death

number.desc: How many seconds should you wait before starting the reload?
number.name: _Delay

number.desc: Number of seconds for the fade out transition.
number.name: _FadeOutTime

number.desc: Number of seconds for the scene to fade back in after reloading.
number.name: _FadeInTime

snippet.desc: This behavior periodically updates the X and Y position of the player in global variables. Those variables are used so that enemies and other actors can easily determine where the player is in order to shoot him.
snippet.description: This behavior periodically updates the X and Y position of the player in global variables. Those variables are used so that enemies and other actors can easily determine where the player is in order to shoot him.
snippet.name: Update Player Position

snippet.desc: This Behavior will handle the player's walking movement while on the ground.
snippet.description: This Behavior will handle the player's walking movement while on the ground.
snippet.name: Walking

control.desc: Select the key used to move to the right.
control.name: _MoveRightKey

control.desc: Select the key used to move to the left.
control.name: _MoveLeftKey

number.desc:
How fast should the Actor get up to speed?

default = 85
number.name: _Acceleration

number.desc:
Maximum speed while walking

default = 20
number.name: _MaxWalkingSpeed

boolean.desc:
Should the speed of the Actor be limited to
the maximum speed specified?
boolean.name: _LimitSpeed

boolean.desc: Does the actor initially face the right direction?
boolean.name: _InitiallyFacingRight

snippet.desc: Creates dust particles behind the actor as he runs.
snippet.description: Creates dust particles behind the actor as he runs.
snippet.name: Create Dust

number.desc: Delay between creation of new tracers (in seconds).
number.name: _Delay

boolean.desc: If this is true, a tracer is currently being created.
boolean.name: _CreatingTracer

snippet.desc: Spawns the Actor Type of your choice when this Actor dies. You can specify the X & Y offset relative to the main Actor, as well as the lifetime of the spawned actor before it dies. Useful for death animations.
snippet.description: Spawns the Actor Type of your choice when this Actor dies. You can specify the X & Y offset relative to the main Actor, as well as the lifetime of the spawned actor before it dies. Useful for death animations.
snippet.name: Spawn Actor upon Death

number.desc: Horizontal offset from the original actor
number.name: xOffset

number.desc: Vertical offset from the original actor
number.name: yOffset

number.desc: How long should the actor stay alive before disappearing?
number.name: lifespan

snippet.desc: Allow the player to simulate even when going off screen. This prevents the player from freezing when leaving the screen.
snippet.description: Allow the player to simulate even when going off screen. This prevents the player from freezing when leaving the screen.
snippet.name: Always Simulate

snippet.desc: Attach this behavior to your Scenes to track the score.
snippet.description: Attach this behavior to your Scenes to track the score.
snippet.name: Score Manager

font.desc:
Select the font to use when displaying the score.
Note: Flash only, but you can use the custom blocks provided to get values such as the score and the font used so that you can set up labels.
font.name: _ScoreFont

number.desc: Horizontal offset from the top left corner of the screen to display the score.
number.name: _XOffset

number.desc: Vertical offset from the top left corner of the screen to display the score.
number.name: _YOffset

number.desc: Minimum number of digits to display on screen. Score will be padded on the left with zeros if the current score does not use up all digits.
number.name: _MinimumDigits

boolean.desc: Should the score be persistent? (e.g. the same between scenes).
boolean.name: _Persistent

snippet.desc: Actor Specific Events
snippet.description: Actor Specific Events
snippet.name: ActorEvents_32

number.desc: Amount of health to start with.
number.name: _StartingHealth

number.desc: Maximum amount of health.
number.name: _MaximumHealth

number.desc: HIDDEN - Tracks the current amount of health.
number.name: _CurrentHealth

text.desc:
Note: This field is only used if the Persistent Health? box is checked.

Enter in any text value. This will be used to track the health of this particular Actor.
text.name: _HealthIdentifier

text.desc:
If a scene is trying to spawn an Actor that uses persistent health - and the health is 0, what should we do?
1. Kill Actor
2. Recycle Actor
3. Do Nothing
text.dropdown: Kill Actor=Kill Recycle Actor=Recycle Do Nothing=Nothing
text.name: _ZeroHealthAction

boolean.desc:
Check this box if the Actor's health should persist from scene to scene.

Note: If this option is checked, you must specify a Game Attribute in the option below.
The Game Attribute selected must be unique to this Actor otherwise the functionality
may be adversely affected.
boolean.name: _PersistentHealth

snippet.desc: Attach this to your jetpack Actor (not the player)
snippet.description: Attach this to your jetpack Actor (not the player)
snippet.name: Jetpack Follow Player

actortype.desc: Attach jetpack to this Actor Type (if not spawned externally)
actortype.name: _PlayerActorType

boolean.desc: Select this option if the jetpack will be spawned externally.
boolean.name: _SpawnedExternally

snippet.desc: Attach this to your jetpack Actor (not the player)
snippet.description: Attach this to your jetpack Actor (not the player)
snippet.name: Jetpack Follow Player

actortype.desc: Attach jetpack to this Actor Type (if not spawned externally)
actortype.name: _PlayerActorType

boolean.desc: Select this option if the jetpack will be spawned externally.
boolean.name: _SpawnedExternally

snippet.desc: Add a jetpack to your Actor and tweak its attributes.
snippet.description: Add a jetpack to your Actor and tweak its attributes.
snippet.name: Jetpack

number.desc: Amount of Fuel currently left in the jetpack tank.
number.name: _CurrentFuel

number.desc: Maximum amount of fuel that the jetpack tank can hold.
number.name: _MaximumFuel

number.desc: How fast should the fuel be consumed when the jetpack is active?
number.name: _ConsumptionRate

number.desc: Amount of upward force applied when the jetpack is being used.
number.name: _Thrust

number.desc: Cap the upward speed to this number to prevent excessive speeds.
number.name: _MaxSpeed

number.desc: Width of the fuel bar (in pixels).
number.name: _FuelBarWidth

number.desc: Height of the fuel bar (in pixels).
number.name: _FuelBarHeight

color.desc: Color of the gauge when the fuel is over 75%
color.name: _Over75Color

color.desc: Color of the gauge when the fuel is over 50%
color.name: _Over50Color

color.desc: Color of the gauge when the fuel is over 25%
color.name: _Over25Color

color.desc: Color of the gauge when the fuel is under 25%
color.name: _Under25Color

number.desc: How fast should the fuel be recharged when the jetpack is inactive?
number.name: _RechargeRate

number.desc: Horizontal offset from the Actor.
number.name: _FuelBarXOffset

number.desc: Vertical offset from the Actor.
number.name: _FuelBarYOffset

number.desc: Which way should the jetpack move the Actor by default?
number.dropdown: North=270 South=90 East=0 West=180 Northeast=315 Southeast=45 Southwest=135 Northwest =225
number.name: _ThrustDirection

text.desc: Should the fuel bar display horizontally or vertically?
text.name: _FuelBarOrientation

control.desc: Control Used to activate the jetpack.
control.name: _JetpackKey

boolean.desc: Select this option to use the active jetpack animations specified below.
boolean.name: _UseAnimations

animation.desc: Enter the name animation to use while facing right and the jetpack is active.
animation.name: _PlayerAnimRight

boolean.desc: Select this option if you will be using an external jetpack Actor. Leave blank if you want to use player animations to represent the jetpack.
boolean.name: _SpawnExternalJetpack

animation.desc: Enter the name animation to use while facing left and the jetpack is active.
animation.name: _PlayerAnimLeft

actortype.desc: Select the Actor Type to use as your jetpack.
actortype.name: _JetpackActorType

number.desc: Amount of force to apply when fuel is depleted but the jetpack key is down.
number.name: _SputterForce

snippet.desc: Spawn bullets from the actor's position.
snippet.description: Spawn bullets from the actor's position.
snippet.name: Fire Bullet

number.desc: The speed at which the created actor will move.
number.name: _BulletSpeed

actortype.desc:
The bullet actor type to create.
If you want the bullets to be killed on collision or when leaving the screen, attach Die On Collision and/or Die On Leaving Screen to the bullet actor type.
actortype.name: _ActorType

number.desc: The direction in which the created actor will move.
number.dropdown: North=-90 North East=-45 East=0 South East=45 South=90 South West=135 West=180 North West=-135
number.name: _Direction

number.desc: The offset in the direction of movement at which the actor will be created.
number.name: _Offset

boolean.desc: If selected, recycled actors will be created.
boolean.name: _Recycled

boolean.desc: If selected, <var>Direction</var> will be used as an absolute direction independently from the current direction of the actor.
boolean.name: _AbsoluteDirection

boolean.desc: If selected, holding down the mouse will fire bullets.
boolean.name: _UsetheMouse

boolean.desc:
If selected, holding down the Fire Control will fire bullets.

You can also trigger the FireBullet event to fire a bullet.
boolean.name: _UseControls

number.desc: The maximum number of actors to be alive at the same time. Only used if <var>Limit Bullets Alive</var> is selected.
number.name: _MaximumBulletsAlive

boolean.desc: If selected, no more than <var>Maximum Bullets Alive</var> can be alive at the same time.
boolean.name: _LimitBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of actors created per second.
number.name: _RateOfFire

number.desc:
The current ammunition the actor has when created. Trigger the Reload event to set the current ammunition to the maximum ammuntion.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
number.name: _CurrentAmmunition

number.desc:
The maximum ammunition the actor can have.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
number.name: _MaximumAmmunition

boolean.desc: If selected, the current ammunition will be reduced by one, every time an actor is created.
boolean.name: _UseAmmunition

Default: 3

number.name: damage

snippet.desc: Allows the actor to move left and right.
snippet.description: Allows the actor to move left and right.
snippet.name: 2 Way Horizontal Movement

boolean.desc:
If selected, the control attributes will be used to control the movement.
If unselected, the control attributes are ignored and the movement can be controlled by triggering custom events. Trigger the events MoveLeft or MoveRight to make the actor move as if the keys were pressed.
boolean.name: _UseControls

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor will not be able to move vertically.
boolean.name: _PreventVerticalMovement

number.desc: The speed of the movement.
number.name: _Speed

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor will not be able to turn while moving.
boolean.name: _StopTurning

boolean.desc: If selected, the animation attributes will be used, otherwise they will be ignored.
boolean.name: _UseAnimations

number.desc: The speed at which the created actor will move.

actortype.desc:
The bullet actor type to create.
If you want the bullets to be killed on collision or when leaving the screen, attach Die On Collision and/or Die On Leaving Screen to the bullet actor type.
actortype.name: _ActorType

number.desc: The offset in the direction of movement at which the actors will be created.
number.name: _Offset

boolean.desc: If selected, recycled actors will be created.
boolean.name: _Recycled

boolean.desc: If selected, the direction of movement for the bullets will be independent from the current direction of the actor.
boolean.name: _AbsoluteDirection

boolean.desc: If selected, holding down the mouse will fire bullets.
boolean.name: _UsetheMouse

boolean.desc:
If selected, holding down the Fire Control will fire bullets.

You can also trigger the FireBullet event to fire a bullet.
boolean.name: _UseControls

number.desc: The maximum number of actors to be alive at the same time. Only used if <var>Limit Bullets Alive</var> is selected.
number.name: _MaximumBulletsAlive

boolean.desc: If selected, no more than <var>Maximum Bullets Alive</var> can be alive at the same time.
boolean.name: _LimitBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of actors created per second.
number.name: _RateOfFire

number.desc:
The current ammunition the actor has when created. Trigger the Reload event to set the current ammunition to the maximum ammuntion.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
number.name: _CurrentAmmunition

number.desc:
The maximum ammunition the actor can have.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
number.name: _MaximumAmmunition

number.desc: The number of actors to create each time.
number.name: _NumberofBullets

boolean.desc: If selected, the current ammunition will be reduced by one, every time an actor is created.
boolean.name: _UseAmmunition

snippet.desc: Actor Specific Events
snippet.description: Actor Specific Events
snippet.name: ActorEvents_64

number.desc: Current health of this actor.
number.name: currHealth

snippet.desc: Allows the actor to move up, down, left and right as well as in diagonal directions.
snippet.description: Allows the actor to move up, down, left and right as well as in diagonal directions.
snippet.name: 8 Way Movement

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor will not be able to turn while moving.
boolean.name: _StopTurningWhileMoving

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will move in diagonal directions at the same speed as in axis-aligned directions.
If unselected, the actor will move in diagonal direction at a speed that is the sum of the axis-aligned velocities.
boolean.name: _NormalizeDiagonalSpeed

boolean.desc:
If selected, the control attributes will be used to control the movement.
If unselected, the control attributes are ignored and the movement can be controlled by triggering custom events.
Trigger the events MoveUp, MoveDown, MoveLeft or MoveRight to make the actor move as if the keys were pressed.
boolean.name: _UseControls

number.desc: The speed of the movement.
number.name: _Speed

boolean.desc: If selected, the animation attributes will be used, otherwise they will be ignored.
boolean.name: _UseAnimations

boolean.desc: If selected and moving in a diagonal direction, the Up and Down animations will be used, otherwise the Left and Right animations will be used.
boolean.name: _PreferVerticalAnimtations

snippet.desc: Spawn actors around this one.
snippet.description: Spawn actors around this one.
snippet.name: Spawn Minions

number.desc: Delay between minions.
number.name: _Delay

number.desc: The offset in either direction horizontally. 10 will let it spawn -10 or 10 away.
number.name: _OffsetX

number.desc: Y offset.
number.name: _OffsetY

snippet.desc: This makes the actor that has this behavior follow another actor, the leader can be the player or even another actor. intended for top down view games with 4 or 8 directions of movement.
snippet.description: This makes the actor that has this behavior follow another actor, the leader can be the player or even another actor. intended for top down view games with 4 or 8 directions of movement.
snippet.name: Follow a target

actortype.desc: This is the actor that will have the Leader Region set around them, should be the same as Type to follow
actortype.name: _Typetolocate

actortype.desc: This is the actor that will be followed by the actor with this behavior, should be the same as Type to locate
actortype.name: _Typetofollow

number.desc: This is to determine the direction between the follow actor and the leader actor DO NOT TAMPER WITH! doing so may induse anxiety, high blood pressure, sadness, rage, and frequent visits to the stencylsupport chat.
number.name: _TargetDirection

number.desc: How fast this Actor will follow the player or target.
number.name: _FollowSpeed

number.desc: The height of the Target's detection region.
number.name: _TargetRegionHeight

number.desc: the width of the Target's detection region.
number.name: _TargetRegionWidth

snippet.desc:
This behavior will cause the actor that it is attached on to never leave the screen, then when the camera moves it will not be left behind. Very useful for things like HUDs, Inventory, or anything that must be on the screen.
FUNCTIONS: Fixed on screen: Always on the screen, and in a fixed point. Move Free: Always in the screen, but can move freely. - Bounce: Bounce on the sides of the screen - Teleport: Teleported back when tries to leave the screen - Cant Exit: The object cant pass the sides of the screen, like if they were glass walls and when the camera moves its pushed by the screen
=VERY CUSTOMISABLE=
snippet.description:
This behavior will cause the actor that it is attached on to never leave the screen, then when the camera moves it will not be left behind. Very useful for things like HUDs, Inventory, or anything that must be on the screen.
FUNCTIONS: Fixed on screen: Always on the screen, and in a fixed point. Move Free: Always in the screen, but can move freely. - Bounce: Bounce on the sides of the screen - Teleport: Teleported back when tries to leave the screen - Cant Exit: The object cant pass the sides of the screen, like if they were glass walls and when the camera moves its pushed by the screen
=VERY CUSTOMISABLE=
snippet.name: Always on Screen

number.desc:
- Determines the position "X" of the object on screen.
- If you put "0", the object will be always on the left side of the screen. - And the greater the number, nearest to the right side it will be. - If position X=0 and Y=0 it will be on the upper left corner.
number.name: _PositionXonScreen

number.desc:
- Determines the position "Y" of the object on screen.
- If you put "0", the object will be always on the top of the screen. - And the greater the number, nearest to the bottom of the screen it will be. - If position X=0 and Y=0 it will be on the upper left corner.
number.name: _PositionYonScreen

boolean.desc:
- If Yes, the object will be always in the same point of the screen, so it wont move, useful for HUDs, menus and others.
- If No, Select the other option.
boolean.fullname: Should the object be fixed on a point of the screen?
boolean.name: _Fixedonscreen

boolean.desc:
- If Yes, it will be always on the screen but its free to move.
- If No, select the other option.
boolean.fullname: Or should it move free on the screen?
boolean.name: _Movefree

number.desc:
1 ---> Bounce in the sides of screen. 2 ---> Teleported Back to the screen. 3 ---> Cant pass the sides of the screen and when the camera moves its pushed with it.
*Other values than 1, 2 or 3 wont make anything.
number.fullname: If it move free, Put a number between 1-3
number.name: _IfitmovefreePutanumberbetween13

number.desc: - The force in which the object will be sended back. *If you choosed number 1.
number.name: _Forceofbounce

boolean.desc: *If you choosed number 2.
boolean.fullname: Teleport to the center of the screen?
boolean.name: _TeleportCenter

number.desc: - Put the X position to where the object will be teleported. *If you choosed number 2.
number.fullname: If not to the center, to what X position?
number.name: _XTeleport

number.desc: - Put the Y position to where the object will be teleported. *If you choosed number 2.
number.fullname: If not to the center, to what Y position?
number.name: _YTeleport

boolean.desc: - If the object hit the sides it will be slowed down completely (0 speed) *If you choosed number 2 or 3.
boolean.fullname: When the object hit the sides of screen, slow down its speed to 0?
boolean.name: _SlowDown0

number.desc: *If you choosed number 3.
number.fullname: When the object hit the screen it will be placed how much pixels back?
number.name: _PixelsBack

snippet.desc: Displays a simple minimap of the scene and the player.
snippet.description: Displays a simple minimap of the scene and the player.
snippet.name: Simple Minimap

actor.desc: The actor to display on the minimap (usually the player).
actor.name: _Player

number.desc: The width of the minimap, in pixels.
number.name: _Width

number.desc: The height of the minimap, in pixels.
number.name: _Height

number.desc: The horizontal coordinate of the minimap, relative to the top-left corner of the screen.
number.name: _X

number.desc: The vertical coordinate of the minimap, relative to the top-left corner of the screen.
number.name: _Y

number.desc: The opacity of the minimap.
number.name: _Opacity

color.desc: The color of the player in the minimap.
color.name: _PlayerColor

number.desc: The size, in pixels, of circle that represents the player on the minimap.
number.name: _PlayerSize

snippet.desc: This behavior simulates an on-screen button. Attach this to an actor with two button animations, a 'normal' state and a 'pressed down' state.
snippet.description: This behavior simulates an on-screen button. Attach this to an actor with two button animations, a 'normal' state and a 'pressed down' state.
snippet.name: On Screen Button

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an unpressed state.
animation.name: _NormalAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an pressed-down state.
animation.name: _PressedAnimation

control.desc: The Control that this button maps to.
control.name: _Control

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor will be killed in Flash games. This is useful for creating On Screen Buttons that only appear in iOS games.
boolean.name: _KillActorinFlash

snippet.desc: Prevent the actor from leaving the screen.
snippet.description: Prevent the actor from leaving the screen.
snippet.name: Cannot Exit Screen

snippet.desc: Make the actor appear on the opposite site of the screen when it leaves the screen.
snippet.description: Make the actor appear on the opposite site of the screen when it leaves the screen.
snippet.name: Wrap Around Screen

number.desc: The x-component of how many pixels of the actor are still visible before it wraps around the screen, and the x-component of how many pixels will be visible after it wraps around the screen.
number.name: _WrapX

number.desc: The y-component of how many pixels of the actor are still visible before it wraps around the screen, and the y-component of how many pixels will be visible after it wraps around the screen.
number.name: _WrapY

snippet.desc: Make the actor appear on the opposite site of the scene when it leaves the scene.
snippet.description: Make the actor appear on the opposite site of the scene when it leaves the scene.
snippet.name: Wrap Around Scene

number.desc: The x-component of how many pixels of the actor are still visible before it wraps around the scene, and the x-component of how many pixels will be visible after it wraps around the scene.
number.name: _WrapX

number.desc: The y-component of how many pixels of the actor are still visible before it wraps around the scene, and the y-component of how many pixels will be visible after it wraps around the scene.
number.name: _WrapY

snippet.desc:
Prevent the actor from leaving the scene.

The actor will still be able to leave the screen, but it cannot leave the scene.
snippet.description:
Prevent the actor from leaving the scene.

The actor will still be able to leave the screen, but it cannot leave the scene.
snippet.name: Cannot Exit Scene

snippet.desc: Actor Specific Events
snippet.description: Actor Specific Events
snippet.name: ActorEvents_127

snippet.desc: Actor Specific Events
snippet.description: Actor Specific Events
snippet.name: ActorEvents_137

snippet.desc: The Health Manager will track the Actor's current health, as well as provide blocks for healing and damaging the Actor. It can also send messages to other behaviors to allow for a wide range of functionality.
snippet.description: The Health Manager will track the Actor's current health, as well as provide blocks for healing and damaging the Actor. It can also send messages to other behaviors to allow for a wide range of functionality.
snippet.name: Health Manager

number.desc: Amount of health to start with.
number.name: _StartingHealth

number.desc: Maximum amount of health.
number.name: _MaximumHealth

number.desc: HIDDEN - Tracks the current amount of health.
number.name: _CurrentHealth

text.desc: Send this message to all behaviors when the Actor is healed by any amount. Remove value to prevent a message from being sent.
text.name: _HealedMessage

text.desc: Send this message to all behaviors when the Actor is damaged by any amount. Remove the value to prevent a message from being sent.
text.name: _DamagedMessage

text.desc:
What should we do when the health reaches zero?
1. Kill Actor
2. Recycle Actor
3. Do Nothing
text.dropdown: Kill Actor=Kill Recycle Actor=Recycle Do Nothing=Nothing
text.name: _ZeroHealthAction

number.desc: How long should the Actor become temporarily invincible after being damaged?
number.name: _DelayBetweenDamage

boolean.desc: Check this box if the Actor's health should persist (stay the same) from scene to scene.
boolean.name: _PersistentHealth

game-attribute.desc:
Note: This option is only used if the Persistent Health? box is checked.

Select a Game Attribute to track the health for this Actor. Make sure the Attribute starts with a value of 0 (zero). Do not use the same attribute for more than one Actor.
game-attribute.name: _HealthGameAttribute

text.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The name of the game attribute created within the behaviour.
text.name: _HealthIdentifier

sound.desc: Play this sound when the Actor is damaged.
sound.name: _DamageSound

sound.desc: Play this sound when the Actor is killed.
sound.name: _DeathSound

sound.desc: Play this sound when the Actor is healed.
sound.name: _HealSound

number.desc: Vertical offset of the newly spawned actor from the original Actor.
number.name: yOffset

number.desc: Horizontal offset of the newly spawned actor from the original Actor.
number.name: xOffset

text.desc: Should the newly spawned actor be normal or recycled?
text.name: _SpawnType

boolean.desc: Should the actor spawn another actor on death? Useful for death effects such as explosions.
boolean.name: _SpawnActorOnDeath

number.desc: How long should the actor stay alive before disappearing? Leave at 0 to prevent the Actor from being removed.
number.name: lifespan

number.desc: Horizontal offset in pixels
number.name: _HealthBarXOffset

text.desc: Actor space (relative to upper left coordinate of Actor), or Screen Space (where 0,0 is upper left of screen)?
text.name: _DrawingLocation

number.desc: Vertical offset in pixels
number.name: _HealthBarYOffset

number.desc: How many pixels should the outline be? Set to 0 to prevent an outline from drawing.
number.name: _HealthBarOutlineSize

number.desc: In pixels
number.name: _HealthBarHeight

number.desc: In pixels
number.name: _HealthBarWidth

color.desc: Enter an outline colour that will display around the background of the health bar
color.name: _HealthBarOutlineColour

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is over 50%.
color.name: _ColourOver50

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is over 25%.
color.name: _ColourOver25

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is over 75%.
color.name: _ColourOver75

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is under 25%.
color.name: _ColourUnder25

color.desc: Background colour of the health bar.
color.name: _HealthBarBackgroundColour

snippet.desc: Actor Specific Events
snippet.description: Actor Specific Events
snippet.name: ActorEvents_160

actortype.desc: Name the animations according to how much health they represent.
actortype.name: _HealthActorType

snippet.desc: Scene Specific Events
snippet.description: Scene Specific Events
snippet.name: SceneEvents_1

snippet.desc: Shows an Intro Title, which slides away after the specified time.
snippet.description: Shows an Intro Title, which slides away after the specified time.
snippet.name: Intro Title

boolean.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE. Whether or not the slide-off has started.
boolean.name: started

font.desc: The font to use when drawing the intro title. Specify from the list of fonts you have created in Stencyl.
font.name: _FontToUse

number.desc: The amount of time, in seconds, before that the intro title should wait before beginning its exit of the screen.
number.name: _TimeBeforeRetreat

number.desc: The y-position, in screen coordinates, of the centre of the Intro Title.
number.name: _YCentrePosition

text.desc:
Show this text in the Intro Title. Leave blank to use the scene's name.
Note: Currently Flash only. You can use the custom blocks provided to get the text, centre x/y positions and font being used if you wish to set up the label behaviour.
text.name: _AlternativeText

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE. The speed to slide off the screen at.
number.name: _SlideSpeed

boolean.desc: Should a rounded rectangle be drawn behind the text?
boolean.name: _DrawRectangle

number.desc: The x-position, in screen coordinates, of the centre of the Intro Title.
number.name: _XCentrePosition

color.desc: The fill colour for the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn.
color.name: _FillColour

color.desc: The stroke colour for the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn. (Stroke is the outline).
color.name: _StrokeColour

number.desc: Padding around the text, in pixels, for the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn.
number.name: _Padding

number.desc: The thickness, in pixels, of the stroke around the outside of the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn.
number.name: _StrokeThickness

text.desc: The direction the Intro Title slides away to.
text.name: _SlideDirection

number.desc: The amount the rounded rectangle is rounded, if one is drawn. (Use 0 for right-angled corners).
number.name: _Rounding

snippet.desc: Actor Specific Events
snippet.description: Actor Specific Events
snippet.name: ActorEvents_206

snippet.desc: Actor Specific Events
snippet.description: Actor Specific Events
snippet.name: ActorEvents_202

snippet.desc: Displays the health of the chosen actor in the top left corner. Use whenever you want to have the scene "know" the health of a particular actor. Designed to work with the Lives Counter and Lives Detector Behaviors.
snippet.description: Displays the health of the chosen actor in the top left corner. Use whenever you want to have the scene "know" the health of a particular actor. Designed to work with the Lives Counter and Lives Detector Behaviors.
snippet.name: Health Monitor HUD v2

actor.desc: Pick the actor whose health you want to monitor.
actor.name: actor

actortype.desc: This should the the ship/Actor you want to the player to control.
actortype.name: _PlayerActor

snippet.desc: Switch scene when the user clicks or touches the screen.
snippet.description: Switch scene when the user clicks or touches the screen.
snippet.name: Switch Scene on Click or Touch

number.desc: The time to fade out, in seconds.
number.name: _FadeOutTime

number.desc: The time to fade in, in seconds.
number.name: _FadeInTime

snippet.desc: Reload the scene when a particular actor dies.
snippet.description: Reload the scene when a particular actor dies.
snippet.name: Reload Scene On Actor Death

number.desc: The time, in seconds, to fade out for.
number.name: _FadeOutTime

number.desc: The time, in seconds, to fade in for.
number.name: _FadeInTime

snippet.desc: Gives actor the notion of Health.
snippet.description: Gives actor the notion of Health.
snippet.name: Health

number.desc: Decrements by this amount if the colliding actor did not specify a damage amount.
number.name: defaultDmg

number.desc: Current health of this actor.
number.name: currHealth

number.desc: Upper bound for health.
number.name: maxHealth

number.desc: Starting amount of health. Can't exceed max health.
number.name: initHealth

actor.desc: Don't let the same actor cause multiple damages to happen.
actor.name: actorCache

boolean.desc: Make this actor die when its health reaches or falls below 0.
boolean.name: dieOnDepletedHealth

number.desc:
The amount of time the Actor will be invulnerable after being hit.

Value of 0 (zero) means that the Actor will never become invulnerable.
Value > 0 means that the Actor will be invulernable for that many seconds.
number.name: tempInvulnerabilityTime

number.desc:
The amount of time to wait before the Actor can be hit by the same Actor it just collided with.

Value of 0 (zero) means that the Actor can't collide with the same actor twice, unless it collides with another actor first.
Value > 0 means that a collision with the same Actor can not occur for that many seconds.
number.name: sameActorCollideAfter

snippet.desc:
Fades out the actor and kills it after a specified time.
You can also set the fade time to zero and have no fade.
snippet.description:
Fades out the actor and kills it after a specified time.
You can also set the fade time to zero and have no fade.
snippet.name: Fade Out and Die after Time

number.desc:
The time in seconds it takes for the actor to begin fading out.

Default: 1
number.name: _StartFadingAfter

number.desc:
The amount of time in seconds it takes the actor to fade all the way out and die.

Default: 3
number.name: _FadeTime

snippet.desc: Attach this Behavior to any Actor that will inflict damage upon another Actor that comes into contact with it. The "other" Actor should have the "Health Manager" Behavior for this to work properly.
snippet.description: Attach this Behavior to any Actor that will inflict damage upon another Actor that comes into contact with it. The "other" Actor should have the "Health Manager" Behavior for this to work properly.
snippet.name: Inflicts Collision Damage

number.desc: Damage to inflict when the other Actor collides with the top.

number.desc: Damage to inflict when the other Actor collides with the bottom.
number.name: _BottomDamageAmount

number.desc: Damage to inflict when the other Actor collides with the right.
number.name: _RightDamageAmount

number.desc: Damage to inflict when the other Actor collides with the left.
number.name: _LeftDamageAmount

list.desc: Only inflict damage on these Actor Groups. Leave blank to inflict damage on any Actor Group.
list.name: _DamageActorGroups

snippet.desc: Spawn an explosion and fragments when the actor dies.
snippet.description: Spawn an explosion and fragments when the actor dies.
snippet.name: Explode On Death

number.desc: The maximum speed at which the fragments fly away.
number.name: _MaximumSpeed

number.desc: The number of fragments to create.
number.name: _NumberofFragments

actortype.desc:
The actor type of the fragments to create.
Make sure the actor type of the fragments doesn't collide with this actor.
actortype.name: _FragmentActorType

number.desc: The minimum speed at which the fragments fly away.
number.name: _MinimumSpeed

number.desc: The maximum turning speed for the fragments.
number.name: _MaximumTurningSpeed

number.desc: An offset in the direction of movement at which the fragments will be created.
number.name: _Offset

boolean.desc: If selected, the fragments will be recycled actors.
boolean.name: _RecycledActors

actortype.desc:
The actor type of the explosion to create.
Make sure the actor type of the explosion doesn't collide with this actor.
actortype.name: _ExplosionActorType
